topic.title: Configuring a Separate iSCSI Network to use with VSA

body.p: This page describes the procedure to assign a separate iSCSI network to use with VSA nodes. You must configure controller and compute nodes along with VSA to use a separate iSCSI network.
Perform the following procedure to assign a separate iSCSI network:

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Edit the following files at ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data to assign a separate iSCSI network to controller nodes, compute nodes, and VSA nodes:The input YAML files need to be changed during the cloud deployment.
networks.yml: Enter the name of the network-group as shown in the example below. In the following example, the name of the network-group is "ISCSI" and this name should remain consistent in other files too.- name: NET_ISCSI vlanid: 3287 tagged-vlan: true cidr: 172.16.13.0/24 gateway-ip: 172.16.13.1 network-group: ISCSI
net_interfaces.yml: A new field (forced-network-groups) is added in this file, as shown in the sample below. Interface-models - name: INTERFACE_SET_CONTROLLER network-interfaces: - name: BOND0 device: name: bond0 bond-data: options: mode: "802.3ad" miinon: 200 provider: linux devices: - name: Port0_10G1 - name: Port1_10G1 network-groups: - MGMT - TENANT forced-network-groups: - ISCSI
- name: INTERFACE_SET_COMPUTE network-interfaces: - name: BOND0 device: name: bond0 bond-data: options: mode: "802.3ad" miinon: 200 provider: linux devices: - name: Port0_10G1 - name: Port1_10G1 network-groups: - MGMT - TENANT forced-network-groups: - ISCSI
- name: INTERFACE_SET_VSA network-interfaces: - name: BOND0 device: name: bond0 bond-data: options: mode: "802.3ad" miinon: 200 provider: linux devices: - name: Port0_10G1 - name: Port1_10G1 network-groups: - MGMT - TENANT forced-network-groups: - ISCSI
firewall_rules.ymlfirewall-rules - name: PING network-groups: - MGMT - TENANT - EXTERNAL_API - ISCSI - SWIFT
network_groups.ymlnetwork-groups: - name: ISCSI hostname-suffix: iscsi component-endpoints: - vsa
server_groups.ymlserver_groups.yml networks: #Define the Global networks shared across all the Racks - NET_EXTERNAL_API - NET_EXTERNAL_VM - NET_TENANT - NET_MGMT - NET_SWIFT - NET_ISCSI
Commit your changes.git add -A git commit -m "Add Node <name>"
Run the configuration processor:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Run the following command to create a deployment directory.cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml

Run the site.yml playbook using the command below. cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml If the iSCSI network is not explicitly configured on the controller nodes then boot from cinder volumes would fail.
